value: , 10 km north of Nyalam, near the village of Zhonggang (Tibetan name). A monastery built around a cave where the enlightened yogi Milarepa (1040-1123) and his disciple Rechungpa spent many years in meditation. Rebuilt in 1983 with assistance from Nepalese craftsmen.
. There are several sacred sites and caves associated with Milarapa and other Buddhist yogis in the Lapchi mountain area.
. The landscape of the region and the stunning scenery lends itself to trekking.

There is a Bank of China branch located here, but it does not offer ATM or currency exchange service.
Several restaurants are located  along the highway.
